gurmukhi: sunq jIq PUly sB Awvh ] niRp CorXo suin sIsu Furwch ] Xw qy ihXwau sBn kw frXo ] khq sXwm Gt kwrj krXo ]1952]
transliteration: Sounat Jeet Phoole Sabh Aavah|| Nrip Chhodhyo Soun(i) Sees(u) Dhuraavah|| Yaa Te Hiyaau Sabhan Kaa Daryo|| Kahat Syaam Ghat Kaaraj Daryo||1952||
translation: All had been puffed up on hearing the news of victory, but they had become sorrowful on knowing that the king Jarasandh had been released; by this the mind of all had become fearful and all were saying that Krishna had not done the right thing.1952.

gurmukhi: kwrj kIXo lrkwhU ko sXwm jI AYso blI qumry kr AwXo ] Cor dXo krkY krunw iqn kwiF dXo pur qy Pl pwXo ]
transliteration: Kaaraj Keeyo Larkaahoo Ko Syaam Jiaiso Balitoumre Kar Aayo|| Chhodh Dayo Kar-kai Karounaa Tin Kaadh(i) Dayo Pur Te Phal Paayo||
translation: All of them said, “Krishna has done the child’s job by releasing such a powerful one from his custody; he was released earlier and the reward that we got for that was that we had to abandon our city;

gurmukhi: AYso Ajwnn kwm krY ju kIXo hir qY khXo sIsu FurwXo ] Cwf dXo nhI jIq AbY Ar Aaur cmUM bhu lYn pTwXo ]1953]
transliteration: Aiso Ajaanan Kaam Darai Ju Keeyo Har(i) Tai Kahyo Sees(u) Dhuraayo|| Chhaad Dayo Nahijeet Abai Ar Aur Chmoond Bahu Lain Pathaayo||1953||
translation: All of them nodded negatively in affliction at Krishna’s childlike act; after conquering him, he has been left off now; in reality we understand that he has been sent to bring more army.1953.

gurmukhi: eyk khY mQurw ko clo iek Pyir khY niRp lY dl AYhY ] sXwm khY iqh ky sB sMg kho Bt kaun so jUJ mcY hY ]
transliteration: Ek Kahai Mathuraa Ko Chalo Ik Pher(i) Kahai Nrip Lai Dal Aihai|| Syaam Kahai Tih Ke Sabh San Kaho Bhat Kaoun So Joojh Machai Hai||
translation: Someone said that it would be getter to go back to Matura; someone said that the king would come again with his army for war and then who will die in the battlefield?

gurmukhi: Aaur kdwNc koaU hT Twn kY jau lirhY qaU jIq n AY hY ] qw qy n Dwie Dso pur mY ibDnw joaU lyK iliKE soaU hÍYhY ]1954]
transliteration: Aur Kadaanch Ko( i)  Hath Thaan Kai Jau Lar(i)hai Taoo Jeet Na Ai Hai|| Taa Te Na Dhaae Dhaso Pur Mai Bidhnaa Jooo Lekh Likhio Sooo Hvai Hai||1954||
translation: And even if one fought with him, he would not be able to win; therefore we may not go back to the city immediately; whatever God wills, will come to pass and let us see what happens.1954.

gurmukhi: Cwifbo BUpq ko sunkY sBhI mn jwdv qRws Bry ] inD nIr ky BIqr jwie bsy muK qy sB AYis cly su rry ]
transliteration: Chhaadibo Bhoopat Ko Sounkai Sabh-himan Jaadav Traas Bhare|| Nidh Neer Ke Bheetar Jaae Bade Moukh Te Sabh Ais(i) Chlae Su Dare||
translation: The release of the king made all the Yadavas fearful; and all of them talking about various things went to reside on the sea-coast;

gurmukhi: iknhUM nhI sXwm khY Apuny pur Er kau pwie Dry ] Aiq hI hY fry blvMq Kry ibn AwXuD mwr mry ]1955]
transliteration: Kinhoon Nahisyaam Kahai Apoune Pur Kipoun Or Kau Paae Ddare|| At(i) Hihai Dare Balvant Kdare Bin Aayudh Maar Dare||1955||
translation: And none of them advanced his feet towards the city (Matura); all the warriors, beaten up without weapons, were standing there, extremely frightened.1955.

gurmukhi: isMD pY jwie Kry Bey sXwm jU isMD huqy su ikCU kir cwhXo ] Cor khXo BUA Cor deI iqn kY Dn kO ijh lau sr bwhXo ]
transliteration: Sindh Pai Jaae Kdare Bhae Syaam Joo Sindh Houte Su Kichhodh Kar(i) Chaahyo|| Chhodh Kahyo Bhooa Chhodh Daitin Kai Dhan Kau Jih Lau Sar Badhyo||
translation: Krishna went and stood by the seaside and he addressed the sea to do something; when the sea was asked to vacate the earth, while fitting the arrow in the bow,

gurmukhi: kMcn ky giH kY dIey qXwr Bly iknhU iqn kaun AcwhXo ] AYsy khY sB hI Apny mn qY pRB jU sB ko duK dwhXo ]1956]
transliteration: Kanchanndke Grah(i) Kai Deee Tyaar Bhale Kinhoo Tin Kaoun Achaahyo|| Aise Kahai Sabh Hiapne Man Tai Prabh Joo Sabh Ko Doukh Daahyo||1956||
translation: He left the earth and without the desire of anybody he prepared the golden mansions; seeing this all said in their minds that Krishna has removed the sufferings of all.1956.
